You're thinking strategically! Yes, you can use your credit card to buy tickets and then pay off the balance in full before the interest kicks in. This approach is often referred to as "paying off the balance in full" or "paying off the principal."

**How it works:**

1. Buy the tickets: Use your credit card to purchase the tickets, and the full amount will be charged to your account.
2. Pay off the balance: Before the interest-free period ends (typically 21-30 days, depending on your credit card issuer), pay the full amount due on your credit card statement.
3. Avoid interest charges: By paying off the balance in full, you'll avoid any interest charges, and you won't be charged any interest on your purchase.

**Benefits:**

This approach can be a great way to use your credit card to buy tickets while avoiding interest charges. The benefits include:

* No interest charges: You won't be charged any interest on your purchase as long as you pay off the balance in full before the interest-free period ends.
* Rewards and benefits: You can still earn rewards, such as points or cashback, on your credit card purchase.
* Convenience: You can use your credit card to buy tickets online or in-person, and then pay off the balance at your convenience.

**Important notes:**

* Make sure you understand your credit card's interest-free period and payment due date to avoid missing the deadline.
* Paying off the balance in full requires discipline and budgeting to ensure you have the funds available.
* If you're unable to pay off the balance in full, you'll be charged interest on the outstanding amount, and it may accrue quickly.

By paying off the balance in full, you can use your credit card to buy tickets while avoiding interest charges. Just remember to stay on top of your payments and budget to avoid any financial implications.
